title: (x) LanTours - TF Arrow {Marc Oxborrow}
content:
i need to know what font is this   
   
Jp ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011023450im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/17659.jpg)
author: degregorio2

comments.content:
dragon comes close, but differs in some details   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/dragon/ef-light/?s=LANTOURS](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011023450/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/dragon/ef-light/?s=LANTOURS)

near, but its not the same.   
you have a congratulation for your "typographic sprint" ;-)   
   
jp

I think it might be the book weight of TF Arrow from Treacyfaces.   
   
 [http://www.treacyfaces.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011023450/http:/www.treacyfaces.com/)

[Nick Shinn](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011023450/http:/www.shinntype.com/)'s classy [Beaufort](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011023450/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/beaufort/beaufort/testdrive.html?s=LANTOURS&p=96) has equally sharp serifs,   
but unfortunately it's not a perfect match neither.

On the nose, Marc! It's a bit difficult to make out   
the correct weight with that shading/bevelling, but   
it sure looks like it.   
   
 ![LanTours.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011023450im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/17974.gif)
